intro: Pteroneurum carnosum var. polyphyllum, commonly known as the hairy leaf pteroneurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. This variant is distinguished by its multiple leaflets, giving it a more complex foliage structure compared to other varieties of Pteroneurum carnosum.
